text: Click Here to access the Science Products . Request to use MOSDAC Single Sign On user credentials to download the data.

title: Data Sources
text: The significant wave height (SWH) and wind speed for both altimeters are taken from Jason-2 and SARAL/ALTIKA.

title: Processing Steps
text: Using Significant Wave Height (SWH) and wind speed, the wave period is derived based on the data adaptive technique of " Genetic Algorithm " (Remya et al. 2011). The derived wave period is validated using buoy observations from Indian National Center for Ocean Information Services (INCOIS). Wave power is derived based on SWH and estimated wave period.

title: Limitations
text: The products have gaps as they are based purely on track altimeters data.

title: Known problems with data
text: Data problems due to bad weather (heavy rain).

title: File Naming Convention
text: For inter-annual monthly product from Jason-2 and SARAL/ALTIKA: Parametername_Altimetername_month_year. Example: WE_SARL_JUL_2009 represents the wave energy from SARAL/Altika during July 2009. For Monthly climatology of ocean wave energy: Parametername_CLIM_month_start year-end year. Example: WE_CLIM_JUL_2008-2014 represents the wave energy climatology during July 2008-2014.
